sen.j: 旻（みん、生年不詳 - 白雉4年6月（653年7月））は、飛鳥時代の学僧。
sen.e: Min (DOB ? - June 653) was as Buddhist scholar-priest.

sen.j: 608年（推古天皇16年）遣隋使小野妹子に従い高向玄理・南淵請安らとともに隋へ渡った。
sen.e: In 608 following instructions from Imoko ONO (Japan's envoy to Sui dynasty China) he traveled to Sui dynasty China along with Kuromaro TAKAMUKO, Shoan MINABUCHI and others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 24年間隋で仏教のほか易学を学び、632年(舒明天皇4年)8月日本に帰国。
sen.e: For 24 years he studied Buddhism and divination and then returned to Japan in Aug 632.

sen.j: その後、蘇我入鹿・藤原鎌足らに「周易」を講じた。
sen.e: Subsequently he gave `divination` advice to Soga no Iruka and Fujiwara No Kamatari.
Subsequently, he gave divination advice based on "Book of Changes" to SOGA no Iruka and FUJIWARA no Kamatari.

sen.j: 637年（舒明天皇9年）に流星が現れた時には天狗の吠え声と主張し、639年（舒明天皇11年）に彗星が現れた時には飢饉を予告するなど、祥瑞思想に詳しかった。
sen.e: He had a detailed knowledge of omens: in 637 when a meteor appeared he claimed it was the howl of a goblin and, in 639 when a comet appeared he claimed it was a portent of crop failure etc

He had a detailed knowledge of zuisho shiso (literally, auspicious thought, referring to fortunate omens): for example, in 637, when a meteor appeared, he claimed it was the howl of a tengu (goblin) and in 639, when a comet appeared, he claimed it was a portent of famine.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: He had a detailed knowledge of zuisho shiso (literally, auspicious thought, referring to fortunate omens): for example, in 637, when a meteor appeared, he claimed it was the howl of a tengu (goblin) and in 639, when a comet appeared, he claimed it was a portent of famine.

sen.j: 大化の改新のあと、645年（大化元年）に高向玄理とともに国博士に任じられ、649年（大化5年）高向玄理と八省百官の制を立案している。
sen.e: Following the Taika Reforms, in 645 Min (along with Kuromaro TAKAMUKO) was appointed to the role of `Kunihakase` (national level scholar) and together with Kuromaro TAKAMUKO in 649 set up the Ritsuryo (government structure modeled after the Chinese system) form of government ministries.

Following the Taika Reforms, in 645, Min and TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro were appointed to the role of Kunihakase (national level scholars), and in 649, they devised the Hassho hyakkan-sei system (the Ritsuryo [government structure modeled after the Chinese system] form of government ministries).
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Following the Taika Reforms, in 645, Min and TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro were appointed to the role of Kunihakase (national level scholars), and in 649, they devised the Hassho hyakkan-sei system (the Ritsuryo [government structure modeled after the Chinese system] form of government ministries).

sen.j: 翌650年（大化6年）に穴門（長門国）国司から白い雉が献上されると、その祥瑞を説明して白雉と改元された。
sen.e: In 650 the governor of Nagato Province presented the emperor with a gift of a white pheasant which was interpreted as an auspicious omen leading to the era name being changed from Taika (lit. Great Change) era to the new era name of Hakuchi (lit. white pheasant) era.

In the following year of 650, the governor of Anato (Nagato) Province presented the emperor with a gift of a white pheasant which was interpreted as an auspicious omen, leading to the era name being changed from Taika (literally, Great Change) era to the new era name of Hakuchi (literally, white pheasant) era.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ・用語・スペーシングを修正しました。なお、原文中の「白戸」は当時の国名としては見あたらず、「日本書紀」に「穴門の国司が白雉を献上する」という記事があることから、正しくは穴門（ながと、関門海峡および長門国の古称）であると思われ、そのように修正のうえ訳出しました。根拠：[1] http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/%E9%95%B7%E9%96%80%E5%9B%BD/ [2] http://kotobank.jp/word/%E7%A9%B4%E9%96%80
sen.e: In the following year of 650, the governor of Anato (Nagato) Province presented the emperor with a gift of a white pheasant which was interpreted as an auspicious omen, leading to the era name being changed from Taika (literally, Great Change) era to the new era name of Hakuchi (literally, white pheasant) era.

sen.j: 653年（白雉4年）5月、病を得て孝徳天皇の見舞いを受けたが、翌月没した。
sen.e: In May 653 Min fell ill and in spite of a get-well visit by Emperor Kotoku, Min died the following month.

sen.j: 「旻」との表記は、墓に縦書きで記載された「日文」を1文字とみなした誤解であり、本名は日文である。
sen.e: The name `Min` (旻) which appears on his grave is thought to be an erroneous representation of his lay name (日文) where the 2 characters 日+文 have been incorrectly compressed vertically into just one character written as '旻'.

The name 'Min' (which is written in Japanese as "旻") as appearing on his grave is thought to be an erroneous representation of his secular name ("日文") where the two characters "日" and "文" have incorrectly been compressed vertically into just one character written as "旻," therefore, his name should correctly read "日文."
sen.cmt: 用語・表現・形式を修正しました
sen.e: The name 'Min' (which is written in Japanese as "旻") as appearing on his grave is thought to be an erroneous representation of his secular name ("日文") where the two characters "日" and "文" have incorrectly been compressed vertically into just one character written as "旻," therefore, his name should correctly read "日文."
